title: Rice Pudding Recipes from Around the World
description: As delicious desserts go, rice pudding's a triple threat — it's super-easy to make, very versatile, and a genius way to use up leftover rice. So join us as we hit the top stops on our world tour of rice pudding recipes!

About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE 13 Creamy Rice Pudding Recipes from Around the World By Carl Hanson Carl Hanson Carl Hanson is a Senior Editor at Allrecipes who has been writing about food and wine for nearly 20 years. He enjoys creating content that informs, entertains, and assists busy home cooks get nourishing meals on the table for their families. Allrecipes' editorial guidelines Updated on November 13, 2022 Close Creamy, luscious rice pudding is everywhere! So join us as we hit the top stops on our world tour of rice puddings! As delicious treats go, rice pudding's a triple threat—it's super-easy to make, very versatile (as these recipes show), and a genius way to use up leftover rice. So make extra rice, it's time for a trip around the world in a rice-pudding bowl. 01 of 14 Kheer (Rice Pudding) View Recipe Save Photo by Michelle Marques. This India-inspired basmati rice pudding is made with coconut milk, raisins, cardamom, and toasted almonds and pistachios. "This is a very flavorful Indian rice pudding," says PATRICK7. "It's the best rice pudding I've ever had, and very easy to make!" 02 of 14 Arroz con Leche View Recipe Save Photo by gator10. "This Arroz con Leche is the Cuban version of rice pudding," says gator10. "It's richer and sweeter than regular rice pudding. Being Cuban myself, I prefer this version of this delicious dessert to any other. Before serving, sprinkle with cinnamon or garnish with a cinnamon stick, for flair." 03 of 14 Scandinavian-Style Rice Porridge View Recipe Save Diana71 Rice slowly cooks in milk with unsalted butter, becoming extra creamy and tender. Cardamom, sugar, and a topping of melted butter make this porridge real Scandinavian comfort food. "This is a delicious rice dessert known in our family as 'Rumagrit,'" says MaryBeth B. 04 of 14 Guatemala Rice Pudding View Recipe Save Photo by Yoly. Scented with cinnamon, this arroz con leche is a Guatemalan version of rice pudding. 05 of 14 Biko View Recipe Save Photo by dulcemanzana. A Filipino coconut dessert, glutinous white rice, also known as sticky rice or sweet rice, cooks with coconut milk and is baked with a coconut topping. "Biko is one of my favorite desserts," says Beya. "This recipe came out tasting better than the biko I buy at the Filipino store." 06 of 14 Japanese Banana Rice Pudding View Recipe Save Photo by Linda T. "Yummy Japanese dessert and comfort food," says Cynthia. "Good served cold or hot. Japanese desserts are not too sweet, more like European-style." 07 of 14 Swedish Rice Pudding View Recipe Save Photo by SHORECOOK. This Swedish rice pudding is baked to create a rich dessert that's creamy on top and dense at the bottom. "A favorite with Swedes in our Swedish organization," says KOKO48. "Serve with whipping cream and/or sweetened berries, if desired." 08 of 14 Newfie Rice Pudding View Recipe Save Photo by Bren. Bren "A yummy, custard-like rice pudding that will remind you of home if you grew up in Newfoundland," says Cathy. "I was searching for years and upon guidance from my aunt and some tested recipes, I fine-tuned a yummy result! Eat this pudding as is or top with whipped cream, tin of cream, or milk to your liking." 09 of 14 Kalter Milchreis mit Brombeeren (Cold Rice Pudding with Blackberries) View Recipe Save Photo by Baking Nana. Here's a German version of rice pudding. Garnish with fresh seasonal fruit, such as blackberries. "Everyone loved it," says Baking Nana. "This makes more than 4 servings because it is so rich. An easy, yet special dessert to make ahead for entertaining. Note: Cinnamon would be a great addition and then serve with spiced apples instead of berries. 10 of 14 Rizogalo (Greek Rice Pudding) View Recipe Save Photo by Diana Moutsopoulos. "Greek rice pudding is simple, comforting, and delicious," says Diana Moutsopoulos. "Some people in Greece make it with eggs, but my aunt prefers without. Best enjoyed cold -- if you can wait that long!" 11 of 14 Authentic Italian Rice Pudding View Recipe Save Cooking with Italian Joe "Here's my grandmother's authentic Italian world's best rice pudding!" says Cooking Italian With Joe. "Truly smooth and silky texture that fills your taste buds with yum. Garnish with chopped nuts, cinnamon, and whipped cream." 12 of 14 Sweet Sticky Rice with Mangoes View Recipe Save Ciro This delicious traditional Thai rice pudding combines coconut-scented sticky rice with a sweet coconut sauce topped of ripe mango. "So easy and so delicious!" raves Kathyrn. "A trick for making the sticky rice: soak your rice over night and steam the next day. I use a colander and a large pot with a lid to steam the rice and it come out perfect!" 13 of 14 Portuguese Sweet Rice View Recipe Save tguag01 Beaten eggs added at the end create a rich Portugal-inspired rice pudding. "My mom would always make this delicious, creamy rice pudding when we were kids," says John Pacheco. "If a thicker rice is desired, increase rice to 1 1/4 cups and add another egg. Sprinkle with cinnamon." Browse our entire collection of rice pudding recipes. 14 of 14 More of the World's Best Recipes Lomo Saltado (Peruvian Steak Stir-Fry). Chef John Around the World in 10 Complete Menus Explore more: Recipes Desserts Custards and Puddings Rice Was this page helpful? Thanks for your feedback! Tell us why!
